Weekly and monthly ticket holders pay just for the kids and, as always, children under 5 ride free.

LIRR Station Waiting Rooms Remain Open

LIRR to Operate Holiday Service on West Hempstead Branch Thanksgiving Day

With the restoration of West Hempstead Branch weekend/holiday train service, the LIRR will be operating a holiday schedule on the West Hempstead Branch on Thanksgiving Day, November 27. Trains will run every two hours to/from West Hempstead with connecting service at Valley Stream and Jamaica. Pick up a copy of the new West Hempstead Branch timetable or see http://bit.ly/1wuJHIH
Merrick Elevator to be Removed from Service

Starting Monday, December 1, the elevator at Merrick Station will be taken out of service for demolition and replacement. While this project is underway, please use the stairs or escalator. The main staircase was recently renovated and returned to service. An elevator is available at the Bellmore, Freeport or Baldwin stations. The Merrick elevator replacement project is expected to be completed by September, 2015. See http://bit.ly/1bgzE30 for current elevator/escalator status.

Holiday Schedule in Effect on Thanksgiving Day

The LIRR offers extra trains on Wed., Nov. 26 and Thanksgiving Day, Nov. 27. As a reminder, a holiday schedule is in effect on Thanksgiving Day. Off-peak fares/Family Fares are valid the entire four-day holiday weekend (Thurs.-Sun.). Save money with the advance purchase of Family Fare tickets; up to four children, ages 5-11, ride for one dollar (one-way) when accompanied by a fare-paying adult. Children under five ride free. For more info, visit: http://bit.ly/1vx5dlo

When using escalators, never set items on steps or hand rails. Don't take large packages, luggage or strollers on escalators - use an elevator, if available, or stairs. Hold children firmly by the hand; lift children under 5 years old on/off escalators. If you see an escalator in need of repair, call the LIRR at 718-558-8228. Your safety is important to us!
New LIRR Schedules Take Effect Tomorrow, Nov. 17

New LIRR timetables dated Monday, Nov. 17 includes restoration of West Hempstead Branch weekend service; added holiday season Long Beach Branch weekend service; and trackwork on the Babylon, Pt. Jefferson & West Hempstead branches. Pick up the new Nov. 17 timetable or visit http://bit.ly/1GU6B4v for details.
Long Beach Branch - Attention Early-Morning Commuters

Starting Monday, November 17, the current 3:13 AM weekday train from Long Beach will be adjusted to depart later at 3:59 AM in order to provide a more convenient early-morning alternative for customers who start work in the 5:00 AM to 5:30 AM timeframe. With a transfer at Jamaica Station, the rescheduled train will get Long Beach Branch customers to Atlantic Terminal at 4:49 AM.

Port Jervis Line: Weekend Busing - November 9

Metro-North will perform necessary track work along the Port Jervis Line. To accommodate this work, buses will substitute for Port Jervis Line trains between Port Jervis and Harriman stations beginning at 11 PM Friday, November 7 and continuing through 7 PM Sunday, November 9. During these times, all eastbound trains will originate at Harriman. Customers traveling from Port Jervis, Otisville, Middletown, Campbell Hall and Salisbury Mills-Cornwall will board shuttle buses to Harriman Station, where they will transfer to the train. Salisbury Mills-Cornwall buses will depart 10 minutes ahead of the train time. Buses at all other stations will depart at train times. See full details at http://bit.ly/1uuS1qN

S Line – Weekend Planned Service Change
NIGHTS 12:01 AM to 6 AM, Sat to Mon, Nov 8 – 10 42 Street Shuttle operates overnight.
Q Line – Weekend Planned Service Change

10:45 PM Fri to 5 AM Mon, Nov 7 – 10 Coney Island-bound Q trains run express from Prospect Park to Kings Hwy. This service change affects one or more ADA accessible stations. Please call 511 for help with planning your trip. If you are deaf or hard of hearing, use your preferred relay service provider or the free 711 relay. For more information, click on the mta.info link in this email and read station signs.
N Line – Weekend Planned Service Change
11 PM Fri to 5 AM Mon, Nov 7 – 10 N trains run local in both directions between DeKalb Av and 59 St, Brooklyn.
D Line – Weekend Planned Service Changes

11:45 PM Fri to 5 AM Mon, Nov 7 – 10 Coney Island-bound D trains are rerouted via the N from 36 St to Stillwell Av. • To 9 Av, Fort Hamilton Pkwy, 50 St, 55 St, 71 St, 79 St, 18 Av, 20 Av, Bay Pkwy, 25 Av, and Bay 50 St, take the Coney Island-bound D to 62 St-New Utrecht Av or Stillwell Av and transfer to a Manhattan-bound D. • From these stations, take a Manhattan-bound D to 62 St-New Utrecht Av or 36 St and transfer to a Coney Island-bound D. 11 PM Fri to 5 AM Mon, Nov 7 – 10 D trains run local in both directions between DeKalb Av and 36 St
A Line – Weekend and Weekday Planned Service Changes

WEEKEND 11:45 PM Fri to 4:45 AM Mon, Nov 7 – 10 No A trains between Lefferts Blvd and Rockaway Blvd – free shuttle buses provide alternate service via 80 St. Brooklyn-bound trains skip Rockaway Blvd and 88 St. • From Rockaway Blvd and 88 St heading toward Brooklyn, take free shuttle buses to 80 St and transfer to a Brooklyn-bound A. A service operates between Far Rockaway/Howard Beach and 207 St. Free shuttle buses operate between 80 St and Lefferts Blvd, stopping at 88 St, Rockaway Blvd, 104 St, and 111 St. • Transfer between free shuttle buses and A trains at 80 St. All times until Jan 2015 Brooklyn-bound A trains skip 88 St. All times until Jan 2015 Brooklyn-bound A trains skip 104 St.

11:30 PM Fri to 4:30 AM Mon, Nov 7 – 10 No 7 service between Times Sq-42 St and Queensboro Plaza – E, F, N, Q*, S, and free shuttle buses provide alternate service. • Use the E, F, N, and/or Q between Manhattan and Queens. Free shuttle buses make all stops between Vernon Blvd-Jackson Av and Queensboro Plaza. • The 42 Street S shuttle operates overnight. *Q service is extended to Ditmars Blvd from 7 AM to 9 PM on Sat and from 9 AM to 7 PM on Sun. This service change affects one or more ADA accessible stations. Please call 511 for help with planning your trip. If you are deaf or hard of hearing, use your preferred relay service provider or the free 711 relay. For more information, click on the mta.info link in this email and read station signs.

Port Jervis Line: Weekend Busing - November 9

Metro-North will perform necessary track work along the Port Jervis Line. To accommodate this work, buses will substitute for Port Jervis Line trains between Port Jervis and Harriman stations beginning at 11 PM Friday, November 7 and continuing through 7 PM Sunday, November 9. During these times, all eastbound trains will originate at Harriman. Customers traveling from Port Jervis, Otisville, Middletown, Campbell Hall and Salisbury Mills-Cornwall will board shuttle buses to Harriman Station, where they will transfer to the train. Salisbury Mills-Cornwall buses will depart 10 minutes ahead of the train time. Buses at all other stations will depart at train times. See full details at http://bit.ly/1uuS1qN
